website_summaries.verdict: A likeable general-purpose gaming laptop that can handle work and play equally well, as long as you don't need to run off the battery for more than 2.5 hours.
pros: Solid performance for its specs, a snazzy but not flashy design and a really good keyboard for both gaming and not-gaming are the highlights of the Asus ROG Strix Hero Edition

customer_reviews.title: Jesus, the FAN on this thing...
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Looks great; fast; not too heavy; graphics are good enough to make your eyes hurt. Cons - Keyboard stops working at times and requires reboot; sound driver can overpower the speakers at times, and you need the extra volume because THE FAN IS SO FREAKING LOUD. Honestly, it's as loud as my Dyson fan on the '8' setting. Also, certain downloads will trigger 100% disk resource consumption; haven't been able to determine if it's due to Win10, the SSHD, or a combination of the two. Even with the two major issues, still a solid 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Gray McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Disappointmented
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this system because I was struggling at school with my older laptop but this one is far by worse. Right out the box, the computer was extremely slow and freezing the boot time is greater than 1:30 seconds and after you enter your credentials is 3 to 4 minutes. Once I opened task manager the disk was running at a 100%!!! with no program running. I contacted ASUS and after disabling superfetch, notifications, search among other stuff the computer continues to have the same struggles is a shame with some many great specs on the paper this computer fails to perform as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel G.

customer_reviews.title: Meh. 2/5 stars IF THAT.
customer_reviews.text: Long term this laptop is less than impressive. I’ve owned it for a good while now and am more than ready to switch to a new laptop. It runs extremely hot, slow, and is outperformed by <$200 chrome books. Battery drains too fast, can’t leave the house without a charger. CAD software is too much for it to handle 90% of the time. Issues with the backlighting, & asus support is horrible. It’s steadily degraded over the years, with proper maintenance and care. Overall would never recommend this to a friend, and will not buy another asus laptop in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Used to Love Asus...
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months the keyboard stopped working sometimes... so I called and emailed and tried several things that were suggested.. but no change... so I sent it to them to fix... I was without it for about 3 weeks and then not 2 weeks after I got it back it started again... so it is going to be "fixed" again.. but I am about to say no more Asus! their customer service sucks now.. (used to be wonderful!) the agents can hardly speak English, and the list of things they cannot do is awful! I am going to have to be without my computer for another 2 weeks (that is the expedited shipping).... I am about to get really upset!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but for awhile
customer_reviews.text: I used this laptop for video editing and gaming. I was pretty happy with the performance overall. The touchpad is cheap and not very responsive as compared to other laptops.. but I used a Bluetooth mouse. I’ve had this laptop for a year and 3 months now and today it just “shut off” and won’t charge. AC adapter works, the laptop just won’t charge. I would think this laptop would have lasted longer especially since I baby it but today it broke and customer service is terrible. Will not buy ASUS products anymore as I’ve read that other people have had these issues..
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: Mainly play Civilization and World of War Craft They run great took a whole day to down load WOW but only a few hours to download CIV Really needs A fan I bought the HAVIT 5 Fans Laptop Cooling Pad for 14-17 Inch Laptop, Cooler Pad with LED Light, Dual USB 2.0 Ports, Adjustable Mount Stand (Black) RED Fans
customer_reviews.author: Carl T. Doran II

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: I had this laptop for a year now and it sucks. The laptop gets way to hot even with a laptop cooler, both CPU and GPU get in the 90 degrees Fahrenheit. The GTX 1050 4gb can only get to 50-60 fps on Fortnite. The RGB on the keyboard is dim and only has 4 lighting zones! I really wish I could return this and get my money back! The only good thing about this is the screen! Also I am receiving points in the ROG Elite Rewards loyalty program for my review.
customer_reviews.author: Irene T.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this product to anyone since since I turned it on, my PC was fried and there was no other option but to give it the kick in the game it gets more fried and from time to time it gets very, very heavy besides it warms up more that an oven, in the end I do not recommend anyone to buy this, after 4 months I was damaged and did not want to turn it on again, luckily the guarantee still worked but it is a problem because I send it from a country where there is no Asus is 200 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rossen Whannish

customer_reviews.title: Killer laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I love almost everything about this laptop. it doesnt get TOO hot with proper ventilation, it will run most games just fine. The only thing i had issues with was the witcher 3 on max settings. Battery life isnt great, but considering the i7 and GTX1060 theres really not much you can do about that. the worst thing about this laptop is the speakers. They just arent very loud. Its not an issue for me as i use a pair of astros anyway. This bad boy has plenty of USB support for a cam,ketboard,mouse and headset to be plugged in. DP and Hdmi for dual screen outputs leaving you with three screens using the laptop display.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Slow!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely slow all around & struggled to play even older games like grid autosport without having the frame drop off a cliff whenever you got a shot of the crowd on screen behind the cars. I really wanted to like this computer I loved the screen but for the price I couldn't deal with the terrible job it did gaming on some of the weakest games in my library.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Hicks

customer_reviews.title: This ASUS laptop is horrible. Don't purchase. Broke after 12.5 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son in August 2018. He needed a strong laptop with design software and also wanted to be able to play video games. I spent just under $1,000 on this. This ASUS laptopbroke after 12 1/2 months. The warranty was for 12 months, so this didn't help. I would never buy this product again. It was barely used since he has a desktop computer that he used mostly. A ripoff. Very disappointed. We were out almost $1,000 and have no laptop.
customer_reviews.author: JCK

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard stopped working. If you do a search for "Asus GL503VM keyboard not working" you'll see a lot of responses. I do not intend to purchase any Asus product in the future. Credit to Amazon for how they handled the issue.
customer_reviews.author: bjordan1138

customer_reviews.title: Garbage don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Track pad is garbage it’s very unreliable as it seems to lag very often. The hybrid hard drive is garbage as well as it seems to be very slow and causes programs such as google chrome and steam to become unresponsive very often. For gaming this is not well suited, it can only game on low settings for triple A games and only get about 20-40 FPS the FPS fluctuates on triple A games drastically, better off buying a 15 inch screen laptop with a gtx 1060 because what you’re really paying for is the 17.3 inch screen size which is all it has going for it, very nice, but that’s it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob M. Butler

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my sons laptop with this one. Used for Animation classes in college. Works perfectly with the software used at school. Uses it for overwatch and other games still gives it 5 stars .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bam Bam good stuff Yeahhh
customer_reviews.text: Showed up a day before fired it, and bam I'm playing and making music, Haven't bought a decent laptop since 2004. The fans get a bit loud but it runs really good.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Cant get rid of BSOD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over a year ago and hardly ever used it. I wanted to use it to make beats. About a week ago i went to my friends to do music and it was working perfectly fine but then the next day i tried using it and kept getting BSOD (Blue Screen of Death). Ive tried everything from windows help to YouTube tutorials on how to fix it and i just cant. Its probably not the laptop but Windows needs to fix this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It was good while it lasted. And then the motherboard fried out of nowhere. You expect a laptop to last more than two years when you shell out $1500 on it. Specially if you are using it for playing a non-demanding game like Dota most times. One of the worst purchases of my life from a value for money point of view. Never buying an Asus product after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Takes a little long to load some things, but otherwise awesome. The battery though.....I turn it off and the battery still goes dead. I have to plug it in everytime I start it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Alger

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop but don't like the bloatware and SSHD
customer_reviews.text: Initial Thoughts 7/27/18: Decided to just reinstall windows 10 and redownload the necessary drivers. Laptop can run Destiny 2 at medium-high with smooth 60+ FPS so I can vouch for this laptop being a mid-high tier laptop. Only thing I would change is the SSHD. It's a great laptop overall but bloatware seems too much.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Pham

customer_reviews.title: The best laptop so far that i have encountered
customer_reviews.text: The best laptop so far that i have encountered. But although this have drawbacks.All the things were working except for track pad, it gets stuck when heated. but Asus help me getting it fixed. so overall not bad experience. but not great too.
customer_reviews.author: Nachiket

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product, easy to deal with right on time AAA+++++
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: The computer broke down after 8 months. It’s dead already. Waste of $.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G

customer_reviews.title: Nice computer, but only if you need the higher end graphics card.
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop for anything you try to use it for, but don’t pay the extra money unless you need a high functioning graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Frank R. Mackall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his new laptop. He plays online video games with friends and says it is very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Andee

customer_reviews.title: Love This Laptop
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute beast for the price. Runs Battlefield V great, better than my Xbox One does anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Craptop cant run most games without stuttering and after getting everything updated the laptop will crash and start an endless loop of repair that will never stop even when trying to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Maninger

customer_reviews.title: Games look decent when it works..
customer_reviews.text: The games look pretty good when things are running. Lots of lag time, slow to boot, removed items like mindcraft that were already loaded, long time between start up and when you can try to use the computer. Really just doesn't seem like it should be this slow. My laptop I was replacing loads twice as fast with not reason why it should be faster. I can play PUBG, Friday the 13th, Secret World Legends, does lag/freeze like it's taking a long time to process. I'm working to see if there's anything I can do to fix it. Will update
customer_reviews.author: Inkedbettie

customer_reviews.title: very bad product
customer_reviews.text: sorry i ever gave this much for a laptop, a 400 dollar laptop is far better than this junk
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: horrible
customer_reviews.text: it died. the motherboard fried and the customer service said they cant help me. it literally stopped working on its own. during my warranty. horrible device and worse customer service
customer_reviews.author: Mahmoud Asem

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this laptop if you want a laptop :)
customer_reviews.text: You would expect a brand new out of the box laptop to be lightning fast, especially with this price tag. Well, you’d be wrong. I’ve been extremely unimpressed with its performance since the day I first turned it on. I would not blame the manufacturer however, Windows 10 causes many issues and is very poorly optimized. I purchased this in October, it is now may of the next year and the hard drive has failed. I feel like for this much money I should have made a smarter investment. Even after a completely fresh install of windows nothing has changed. Harddrive failing 6 months after purchase? Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: JP Lafreniere

customer_reviews.title: Great screen
customer_reviews.text: I play a couple games and this computer handles it like a champ. Love it, glad I went with it.
customer_reviews.author: randi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love my new laptop it is so much more than I expected it to be.
customer_reviews.author: sundrop

customer_reviews.title: Dead screen after only a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: The laptop's screen died after less than 4 weeks of use, without no cause. Totally unacceptable for such a product. One evening it was fine. The next morning the screen was dead, either not lighting up or showing scrambled views. I had a few other issues with the PC: - it froze a few times a day - you move the mouse but no cursor reaction for a few seconds. - very hot underside. I often use the laptop sitting on my knees: well there you need a towel or something to protect you from burnings. Bottom line: sent back to Amazon (thanks for the amazing support). It was my 3rd Asus in a row: never again!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Great computer for its price. Runs fast and have had no lagging or issues.
customer_reviews.author: John brown

customer_reviews.title: Failing graphics card
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 5 months ago and my graphics card is already failing...
customer_reviews.author: Darkhood

customer_reviews.title: Fast Powerful Epic A good buy at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Everything as advertised. Fast Powerful Epic A good buy at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Beau Brown

customer_reviews.title: Screen is amazing Comes with 16gb ram Enough hard drive space for ...
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this laptop. Pros: Screen is amazing Comes with 16gb ram Enough hard drive space for large games Cons: Can't think of any...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love the computer, very good with all my games and very fast! Especially with the Xbox one streaming!
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Healy

customer_reviews.title: Overheated first
customer_reviews.text: CPU temps reaching 95c the first time I opened Overwatch, which was only on the home screen, not while actively playing the game. Contacted Asus, they offered to RMA. Don't but this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Haydn Hennes

customer_reviews.title: Service sucks
customer_reviews.text: Device arrived and would work on AC but not battery..Opened laptop and battery was not connected..Missing ALL screws.. ASUS was no help and Amazon was no help.. Had to return device AND pay $75 more for a new one. May not get before Christmas. Disappointed in service for the first time with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald V. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Really great computer, but no DVD player
customer_reviews.text: Really great computer, but no DVD player....I had to go with the one that would actually ship to my location (island in Alaska)
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Day

customer_reviews.title: It is very bad
customer_reviews.text: The thing is really not that good it’s definitely not a gaming computer the battery life is terrible I turn it off and still it consumes battery life it can’t even run most games i download
customer_reviews.author: A person who reviews things

customer_reviews.title: Nice laptop if the sound worked
customer_reviews.text: Nice laptop if the sound worked...from the looks of the box it was dropped pretty hard..returning it for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Works just as expected. Gets hot but the fan does it's job to keep it from overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice laptop. Exactly what I need for gaming. Very fast shipping too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible products, don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Terrible products, don't buy it. Avoid as much as you can. USB port broken after a half year of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Wang

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The computer doesn't work. It has problems with the RAM. The guarantee does not cover Central America. The packaging used by the seller is not the best, I had to pay an additional charge for the packaging and even then the equipment arrived with defects. Total disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: OSCAR SALAZAR ROJAS

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: If you want a laptop that takes hours to update, this is the one for you. This laptop has been updating since the moment I unpacked it. Been 2 days now. I wonder what it's updating
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Bought This For Home Work Use don't Play Graphic Intense Games Mainly Work Use
customer_reviews.author: Larry Cook

product_meta.title: Asus ROG Strix Hero Edition Gaming Laptop, 15.6” IPS-Type Full HD, Intel Core i7-7700HQ Processor, GeForce GTX 1060 6GB, 16GB DDR4, 256GB M.2 SSD + 1TB Hybrid SSHD, RGB, Windows 10 Home – GL503VM-DB74
product_meta.description: Style:7th Gen Intel Core i7-7700HQ| Capacity:15.6 Inch| Configuration:GTX1060 | 256GB NVMe SSD + 1TB SSHDRog Strix Hero Edition gaming Laptop is designed for multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) players, optimized to deliver a competitive edge. You'll lead the way armed with powerful Intel Core i7 processors and NVIDIA GeForce GTX 10-series graphics. Strix Hero Edition packs a rich-color, 120Hz wide-view display and a desktop-style RGB keyboard that's made for victory, with N-key rollover for Fast, precise Response to your every input and a 20-million-key-press lifetime for ultimate reliability. *The actual transfer speed of USB 3.0, 3.1 (Gen 1 and 2), and/or Type-C will vary depending on many factors including the processing speed of the host device, file attributes and other factors related to system configuration and your operating environment.
feature_bullets: Special design for MOBA gamers: slim 0.9” profile and lightweight 5.6 lbs body with dragonscale pattern. 15.6” 120Hz Full HD IPS-Type panel designed for maximum contrast and clarity
7Th-generation Intel Core i7-7700HQ quad-core 2.8GHz (Turbo to 3.8GHz) with discrete GeForce GTX 1060 6GB graphics. Dual-fan thermal design
256GB PCIe NVMe SSD + 1TB FireCuda SSHD for combination of fast OS drive speed and high capacity storage
Aura RGB lighting keyboard with 4 isolated hotkeys, 1.8mm key travel, and anti-ghosting technology. 4 zones of lighting control. 20-Million keystroke durability
802.11AC 2x2 Wi-Fi (up to 6x faster than traditional BGN); Bluetooth 4.1

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars123 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
